content.description: Thin climbing to a flake.  Then surmount a small roof using small holds.  The summit is fantastic!
content.protection: 4 bolts and gear (#2 c4 and/or stoppers)
content.location: On the same formation as Jupiter but starts in the alleyway next to the Lunatic formation.

content.description: Short. Thin and somewhat slick crimps and pinches lead to an obvious “Thank God” hold and an easy finish. Remember making the 2nd clip as being the crux.
content.location: Uphill side of Stumbling Block. To the right and downhill from Darth Vader.

content.description:
Climb easy ground up the left side of a large flake (gear optional) to reach the first bolt.  Great holds through the crux (2nd bolt) but it's steep so lingering could feel pumpy.

 The Orenczak/Lynn book mentions a variation start along the right side of the flake.
content.protection: Three bolts leading to a chain anchor; optional medium-large gear for the start
content.location: Find the large, right-facing corner of Saturn.  The flake heading up and right from Saturn's base leads to the first bolt.

content.description: Start right of the chimney. Climb through three bolts and traverse left. Then gain the flake to the top.
content.location: Approach the first area from the left. Squeeze into the first passage on the right. Climb starts on the ledge to the right.

content.description: Start in the crack with two pine trees. Climb the face staying right of the arete. Finish on Heat Seeker.
content.location: Six feet left of Heat Seeker. 10 feet right of Minuteman.

content.description: Climb crack and juggy face in corner to anchors.  Or layback the whole route.
content.location: On the middle of the three formations that collectively make up "The Galaxy" find the south-western corner.

content.description: This is a fun, surprisingly tricky, and entertaining little mixed (trad/sport) route. Start off with some physical laybacking of a 5.9 finger crack/flake. Leverage yourself (a bit awkward) onto a smearing stance on a sloping ledge. If you haven't used a stick-clip on bolt one, clip it and hit the crux section-- which involves using some devious sloping crimps to get off the ledge, then pull through a slightly steeper section on more positive crimps and finish with a couple slab moves. Short but varied and sustained.
content.protection: Small cams to a #1 down low in the crack (nuts would work as well). A long stick clip would alleviate the need for those. 2 bolts total. I think it would be possible to scramble up the uphill (East) side of Stumbling Block and throw a toprope on this route to avoid leading it, but I am not sure.
content.location: First Area of Moonlight Ridge next to the trad route Rainbow Brite (5.7), which shares anchors with Raining in Paradise, on the Stumbling Block formation. When facing Darth Vader (5.5)-- this route is straight downhill to your right on the backside (West) of the Stumbling Block formation.

content.description: Pull one or two crux moves to the first bolt and enjoy easier climbing to the top. Typical 5.8 Black Hills granite route, no surprises here.
content.location: On the northernmost of the three rock formations that compose "The Galaxy" area. The route follows the bolted line up the north-west arete.

content.description: Bolted Arete.   This route is in the gap that left and around the corner from Lunatic.

A variation to the start of Minuteman. Instead of climbing the bolt line, start in the flake just right of the bolts. Place some nuts and small cams if you want. Join Minuteman about halfway up the climb at the third bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to chains. Flake can be protected with nuts and small cams.
content.location: Immediately right of Minuteman.

content.description: Casual sport climb up the NE corner of the Galaxy formation. Follow the bolt line to the chains which can be used to TR a couple other routes to the West of this route. Great route to learn the basics of lead sport climbing on. Low incline with a nice resting ledge about 3/4 of the way up before reaching bomber chains.
content.location: Far NE edge of the Galaxy formation. There is quite a bit of vegetation at the base of the route. The bolt line begins at the East end of the gully on the North side of the Galaxy formation. Lower or rap down to the gully on the North side with 1 60 M rope.

content.description: Climb the chimney to Jupiter anchor, or 5.2ish climbing to the very cool summit of Run Amuck Pinnacle and Zeus anchor.
content.location: On the northernmost of the three rock formations that compose "The Galaxy" area.  The route follows the chimney up the south-west side.

content.description: A very sustained and slightly overhanging route up an arete. Like other routes in this area, the holds look huge from the ground and some of them are. However, once on the climb you will find that many "jugs" are actually medium-sized crimpers.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Two bolt anchor with chains on top.
content.location: On the middle of the three formations that collectively make up "The Galaxy" find the noth-western corner and you will see the bolted arete.

content.description: This is the steep slab on the right taller side of stumbling block. The start is a bit vegetated, but the route is taller and better than some of its nearby neighbors. Start climbing the left arete via stemming, laybacking and balancing off the thick left arete. Then angle up and across right on the face which steepens to vertical for a few moves (crux). Crimps and pinches are thin and the feet cryptic in this section. Then mantle onto the top of an attached column on the right side of the formation. Catch a breath and compression and straddle your way up the top of the right arete to the route’s independent anchors. This last part is just a bit easier than it initially looks.
content.location: Far right end of Stumbling Block. Access anchors via leading Rainbow Brite (5.7 Trad) or by scrambling up the back of the formation.

content.description: Very nice route on great rock.  Two mini cruxes at bolts three and four.  Look for the "hidden hold" out left!
content.location: The arete across the gully from "Lunatic".

content.description: Fun sequential climbing on sharp holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Two bolt anchors with chains on top.
content.location: Icarus is on the nothernmost rock formation of the three farmations that compose "The Galaxy". This is the bolted climb in the middle of the western face.

content.description: Start on the right-facing dihedral. Climb straight up the wall to the chains of Minuteman.
content.location: Use the anchors of Minuteman. Route starts about 15 feet right of Minuteman.

content.description: Two bolts protect the face climbing at the top and bottom, the crack offers additional protection between the bolts.
content.protection: 2 bolts, medium nuts or medium cams.
content.location: On the southernmost of the three rock formations that compose "The Galaxy" area. The route follows two bolts and a crack to the summit of the second tallest pinnacle in the group.

content.description: Short TR. Wide awkward arete with thinning crystals and compression moves. A bit dirty. Lead Youranus to access the anchors for Disappearing Planets. Or probably possible to scramble up back of formation to access.
content.location: Left side of Stumbling Block. Around the corner from Youranus (shared anchor) and to the left when facing Raining in Paradise.

content.description: Climb the easy face to the overhang. Traverse a little right to take the easiest way up and around the overhang. There's lots of big holds, so pulling the roof wouldn't be much harder anyway. Then easier ground to the anchors of Darth Vader.
content.protection: None. Top rope from the anchors of Darth Vader.
content.location: The face immediately left of Darth Vader.

climbs.name: Dancing in the Moonlight
climbs.fa: Mike Conlon, T. DeLannoy, Cindy Tolle

content.description: Climb the slabby face following the bolts.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Bolts and slings at top for anchor.  Rap off Lunatic or Saturn on the back side.
content.location: On the middle of the three formations that collectively make up "The Galaxy" find the south-western corner and you will see the bolted slab on the south side of the wall.

content.description: The majority of climbs here are either sport or mixed climbs (i.e bring your nuts and cams). Climbs are short, close together, on good quality rock with closely spaced bolts.
